content.body: what's tricky is that if `o[p] = f()` evaluates `p` before `f` (as it does everywhere, regardless of the double-eval)
content.formatted_body: what's tricky is that if o[p] = f() evaluates p before f (as it does everywhere, regardless of the double-eval)

content.body: then arguing that `o[p] = f()` _should_ evaluate `f` first seems unlikely
content.formatted_body: then arguing that o[p] = f() should evaluate f first seems unlikely

content.body: probably should just fix it
